title: V-sync in League is ABSOLUTELY FUCKING TERRIBLE.
body:
So for years I was playing with v-sync enabled on a 60 hz screen, essentially locked at 60 FPS.

I read that v-sync causes input delay, so I finally saw reason to disable it. The 2 biggest most noticeable things were "dragging items in your inventory" and "dragging portraits on the scoreboard." This single action alone felt 1000x better, and the game in general also felt a lot better. And then of course, when I bring this up on Reddit (not entirely sure why I went there, but I did) they shit on me and say "it's probably a placebo lol."

So since I needed to change the setting on my clean un-modded League folder, I decided to test it today.

Enable v-sync -> buy item (hunter's talisman) -> click item and drag it really fast on the screen (really large circles on a 1080p screen). Item will lag behind the mouse pointer. Like a quarter of a screen behind the mouse pointer if you drag really fast. Disable v-sync -> item won't lag behind the pointer at all.

League is a horribly coded game holy shit.
